str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I taste, (b) I experience. A primary verb; to taste; by implication, to eat; figuratively, to experience.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A dinner, an afternoon or evening meal. From the same as dapane; dinner, i.e. The chief meal.
